page.title: 17Wingate - Nature Reserve - 1
page.content: During the early part of this century,{limestone}was{taken}from this quarry{to}the{steelworks in}nearby {Middlesbrough. When{work}in the quarry{ended in {1957}the area was{left to nature until {1979}when it{became a nature reserve. In that year some reclamation was carried out. Many{interesting}and uncommon {plants and animals}are found here. Because of this,{children}are asked to {keep to the trail}and{follow}the {country code. The{range}of flora and fauna is {tremendous}because of the very{varied {landscape}in such a small, compact area. Habitats vary from{vertical rock {faces}to flat{low lying open areas}and from{dark shady hollows}to one of the {numerous small ponds.}The children find it{exciting to explore.
